meanings.definition: Having or showing a moderate or humble estimate of one's merits, importance, etc.; free from vanity, egotism, boastfulness, or great pretensions.
meanings.sent1: She is the modestest student in the class, always downplaying her achievements.
meanings.sent2: It is modestest to accept compliments graciously without boasting.
meanings.sent3: Even though he won the award, he remained the modestest person in the room.
meanings.sent4: Her modestest demeanor shone brightly in a sea of self-promotion.
meanings.sent5: The modestest approach often garners the most respect.

meanings.definition: Limited or moderate in amount, extent, etc.
meanings.sent1: The modestest portion of cake was just enough to satisfy her sweet tooth.
meanings.sent2: He requested a modestest increase in his allowance to cover his expenses.
meanings.sent3: The modestest serving of ice cream left her wanting more.
meanings.sent4: The modestest rainfall brought relief to the dry land.
meanings.sent5: A modestest effort can sometimes yield great results.

meanings.definition: Free from ostentation or showy extravagance.
meanings.sent1: Her outfit was the modestest at the party, yet she exuded elegance.
meanings.sent2: The modestest decorations at the event still created a warm atmosphere.
meanings.sent3: He drove the modestest car, but it was reliable and efficient.
meanings.sent4: In a world of luxury, she found beauty in the modestest things.
meanings.sent5: The modestest display of affection spoke volumes in their relationship.
